summary: I couldn't stop crying, then counselling changed my life
title: I couldn't stop crying, then counselling changed my life
excerpt: Sometimes you need to talk to a stranger about your problems in order to put them to rest
description:
Like i said in my learning agreement my main drive behind this project is my own experience with finding counselling and how my short 5 week course helped me see the light and push past one of the darkest periods in my life.

This article really backs up exactly how i feel about my experience but at the same time is quite critical, there is studies that show how talking therapy can considerably help people who are suffering but ultimately they are not for everyone. 

“A counsellor is somebody that has no preconceived perceptions of you, doesn’t know who you are and has no prior connection to your life.” In my opinion this is the most important aspect of counselling and i think people who have never experienced it before are quick to shrug it off but it is undeniable how you get a sense of relief offloading problems onto someone unknown to you, its this idea that i want to carry through in this project a platform for people to share there worries in an anonymous way.

summary: You Need This Genius 'Shark Tank' Cutting Board From Williams-Sonoma
title: You Need This Genius 'Shark Tank' Cutting Board From Williams-Sonoma
body:
From Woman’s Day

UPDATE: May 07, 2019 at 1:25 p.m.

Last fall, an emotional Shark Tank episode showed three siblings pitching a cutting board created by their late father, who passed away from cancer related to his work as a New York City firefighter during 9/11. The design and the family’s story caught the Sharks’ eyes and all five invested in the product.

After filming the show, the Young family, Williams Sonoma, and Wisconsin-based kitchen tool manufacturer Epicurean teamed up to refine the product and bring it to the masses. Today, the Cup Board Pros is available for purchase in stores and on Williams Sonoma’s website. Read more about the Young’s story and see their genius product below. It’s made of a durable wood-fiber material and has a detachable silicone tray to gather food scraps, plus a perimeter groove to move liquid and juices into tray.

    ORIGINAL POST: October 25, 2018 at 12:41 p.m.

    The Sharks on Shark Tank can be pretty tough at times - there’s usually a great deal of money at stake, after all. Sometimes, though, there are particularly moving pitches that cause an unusually emotional response from the investors. During a recent episode, tears were shed in the first few minutes of the pitch.

    A group of three siblings, Kaley, Christian, and Keira Young, arrived to the tank ready to pitch the Cup Board Pro, a cutting board with a bowl for scraps attached, made for easy clean-up. Though the young entrepreneurs were clearly passionate about the boards, the invention was actually created by their late father, Keith Young. Keith, a New York City firefighter, passed away from a “9-11-related cancer from being a fireman there,” his daughter told the Sharks. Even more heart-wrenching - he passed just three months before the taping of the program.

    “Our dad invented the Cup Board Pro, and it was his dream to pitch it on Shark Tank,” Kaley says in the episode. “Unfortunately, he passed away before he had that chance. We’re here today to continue his legacy and make that dream a reality.”

    The Young family shows the Sharks Keith’s audition video, during which he reveals that he was a widower. Kaley explains that their mother was diagnosed with breast cancer, and passed in 2012. In their father’s audition video, it’s clear the passion he had for the Cup Board Pro, and the love and dedication he had for his children.

    Kaley told the Sharks that the siblings had sold 300 Cup Board Pros in just three weeks. The emotional Sharks were impressed, and Daymond John asked the siblings to step out of the room for a moment. When they came back in, an amazing offer was waiting for them.

    According to USA Today, John, Mark Cuban, Lori Greiner, Matt Higgins, and Kevin O'Leary came together to offer $100,000 for a 20 percent stake in Cup Board Pro. To top things off, they made a special promise - to donate profits to a charity which helps firefighters that were affected on 9/11, just as the siblings’ father was.

    John tweeted on Sunday (after the episode aired) that the Cup Board Pro had already sold out. According to Sony Pictures Television, they sold over $1 million in sales over just 18 hours, and it’s still sold out on Amazon.

    Wow, the response to the #CupboardPro has been so good that they’ve sold out of product. #SharkTank fans - if you want to support the Young family, donate to their #GoFundMe in honor of the FDNY. https://t.co/Gh2LTzsXt1

    - Daymond John (@TheSharkDaymond) October 22, 2018

    You can sign up to be notified when the Cup Board Pro is back in stock on the website. Also, you can join the Young kids in supporting the FDNY Foundation’s Fired Up for a Cure, by donating to the GoFundMe page they created.

    What a cool family! Wishing the Young siblings the upmost success with Cup Board Pro…and fingers crossed they restock soon, just in time for holiday shopping.

    (‘You Might Also Like’,)

    • 60+ Easy and Satisfying Avocado Recipes You Need to Try ASAP
    • “I Used To Love Getting Naked — And Then I Got Pregnant”
    • 45 Inspirational Books All Women Should Read in Their Lifetime

blog.name: jdeun3
blog.title: JDEun3
blog.description: My name is John D. Eun. I was born in Madison, WI, and raised in Seoul, South Korea. I graduated from Davidson College in NC, and I am now an MD/PhD candidate at the Hofstra Northwell School of Medicine. I don’t know where God wants me to be or how He wants to use me, but I‘m just thankful to be living His life.

summary: Must we wait until we prove every link in the chain of causation?” In protecting health, absolute proof comes late. To wait for...
text: Must we wait until we prove every link in the chain of causation?” In protecting health, absolute proof comes late. To wait for it is to invite disaster or to prolong suffering unnecessarily.
source: William H. Stewart, who served as the Surgeon General under both Lyndon B. Johnson and Nixon, in his keynote address at the 1968 Conference on Noise as a Public Health Hazard, in Washington.

reblog.comment: William H. Stewart, who served as the Surgeon General under both Lyndon B. Johnson and Nixon, in his keynote address at the 1968 Conference on Noise as a Public Health Hazard, in Washington.

summary: Howard Stern reveals cancer scare: 'All I'm thinking is, I'm going to die'
title: Howard Stern reveals cancer scare: 'All I'm thinking is, I'm going to die'
body:
Howard Stern will talk about pretty much anything on his radio show, but a private health matter was off-limits.

In his new book, Howard Stern Comes Again — a collection of his interviews as well as self-reflection — and a sit-down with The Hollywood Reporterto promote it, Stern comes clean about a cancer scare that rocked him in 2017.

The Howard Stern Show host, 65, revealed how on May 10, 2017, he canceled his SiriusXM show, prompting speculation and theories from his devoted fans. While he returned to the air just days later, he lied to the audience about his absence, saying he had the flu. “Why is it such a big deal that I took a f***ing day off?” he asked on air.

Stern now explained that the day in question he was actually in surgery. For the entire year prior, he had visited countless doctors to monitor a low white blood cell count discovered during a routine checkup — as well as a growth on his kidney, which he was told had a 90 percent chance of being cancerous.

“All I’m thinking is, ‘I’m going to die,’” Stern recalled in the interview, his first time discussing the health issue publicly. “And I’m scared s***less.”

View this post on Instagram

A post shared by Hollywood Reporter (@hollywoodreporter) on May 8, 2019 at 5:00am PDT

However, after several hours in surgery, he learned that it had just been a scare and the growth turned out to be a tiny, harmless cyst.

The shock jock revealed that he kept the whole ordeal quiet, only telling his inner circle, including family (wife Beth Stern and three daughters), his Howard Stern Show sidekick Robin Quivers, a cancer survivor and, of course, his therapist.

Stern said going through that has made him face his mortality — and question if it’s time to turn off his microphone, travel with Beth and spend more time with his grown daughters. His contract with SiriusXM, which reportedly pays him $90 million a year, expires at the end of 2020.

“I’m at a place now where I am trying to figure out how to spend the rest of my life, however long that might be,” he told THR. Though, he admitted, “It seems weird to me not to have this [show].”

In addition to discussing the cancer scare with THR, Stern also talked about his relationship with Donald Trump, who for years called into his show or dropped by. Stern said that while he was in contact with the president during the election — and Stern admitted, despite being a Hillary Clinton supporter, he thought she would have a hard time beating Trump — he really hasn’t spoken to him since a congratulatory exchange when Trump won in 2016.

"It was a difficult thing because there’s a part of me that really likes Donald, but I just don’t agree politically,” Stern said. Though, he quipped, “A more self-serving person would have gone all in on Donald because I’d probably be the FCC commissioner or a Supreme Court justice by now.”

Howard Stern Comes Again comes out on May 14. Order it on Amazon.

Read more on Yahoo Entertainment:

  • It’s a boy! Meghan Markle and Prince Harry welcome their first child — all the royal baby details

  • ‘Game of Thrones’ called out for leaving a Starbucks coffee cup in a scene: 'Unprofessional’

  • Kevin Costner slammed as ‘totally brain-dead’ after criticizing the Trump administration, saying Michelle Obama should run for president

Want daily pop culture news delivered to your inbox? Sign up here for Yahoo Entertainment & Lifestyle’s newsletter.

reblog.comment:
Howard Stern will talk about pretty much anything on his radio show, but a private health matter was off-limits.

In his new book, Howard Stern Comes Again — a collection of his interviews as well as self-reflection — and a sit-down with The Hollywood Reporterto promote it, Stern comes clean about a cancer scare that rocked him in 2017.

The Howard Stern Show host, 65, revealed how on May 10, 2017, he canceled his SiriusXM show, prompting speculation and theories from his devoted fans. While he returned to the air just days later, he lied to the audience about his absence, saying he had the flu. “Why is it such a big deal that I took a f***ing day off?” he asked on air.

Stern now explained that the day in question he was actually in surgery. For the entire year prior, he had visited countless doctors to monitor a low white blood cell count discovered during a routine checkup — as well as a growth on his kidney, which he was told had a 90 percent chance of being cancerous.

“All I’m thinking is, ‘I’m going to die,’” Stern recalled in the interview, his first time discussing the health issue publicly. “And I’m scared s***less.”

View this post on Instagram

A post shared by Hollywood Reporter (@hollywoodreporter) on May 8, 2019 at 5:00am PDT

However, after several hours in surgery, he learned that it had just been a scare and the growth turned out to be a tiny, harmless cyst.

The shock jock revealed that he kept the whole ordeal quiet, only telling his inner circle, including family (wife Beth Stern and three daughters), his Howard Stern Show sidekick Robin Quivers, a cancer survivor and, of course, his therapist.

Stern said going through that has made him face his mortality — and question if it’s time to turn off his microphone, travel with Beth and spend more time with his grown daughters. His contract with SiriusXM, which reportedly pays him $90 million a year, expires at the end of 2020.

“I’m at a place now where I am trying to figure out how to spend the rest of my life, however long that might be,” he told THR. Though, he admitted, “It seems weird to me not to have this [show].”

In addition to discussing the cancer scare with THR, Stern also talked about his relationship with Donald Trump, who for years called into his show or dropped by. Stern said that while he was in contact with the president during the election — and Stern admitted, despite being a Hillary Clinton supporter, he thought she would have a hard time beating Trump — he really hasn’t spoken to him since a congratulatory exchange when Trump won in 2016.

"It was a difficult thing because there’s a part of me that really likes Donald, but I just don’t agree politically,” Stern said. Though, he quipped, “A more self-serving person would have gone all in on Donald because I’d probably be the FCC commissioner or a Supreme Court justice by now.”

Howard Stern Comes Again comes out on May 14. Order it on Amazon.

blog.description: Sheila 'SuperWoman' St. James, M. Ed. is "America's Top Health, Beauty, and Fitness Specialist" ...

summary: #Health and Healing 💋 A few years ago, I fainted due to job related stress (I had never fainted before)and I fell forwards on my...
caption:
#Health and Healing 💋 A few years ago, I fainted due to job related stress (I had never fainted before)and I fell forwards on my face with my mouth wide open and: busted my upper lip from front to back; knocked out my two front teeth and some of my (chipped)teeth were inside my injured lip👄 The days following I had two very horriferous black eyes, a fractured nose and a concussion. I was unrecognizable; and being a #FaceModel -this was the worse thing that could have ever happened to me! What a mess-I was beyond DEVASTATED😓Miraculously, I was fully healed within 6 weeks, no plastic surgery needed🙏🏾and I was back on stage as a celebrity model in a fashion show just 6 weeks later(picture on the right)…And I want to share with you that: If and when something traumatic🤕 such as this happens-don’t try those Frankenstein techniques and all that voodoo magic stuff👹Go to the EMERGENCY ROOM🚨The doctor that stitched me up, did an amazing job and because of him, I didn’t need any plastic surgery🙏🏾Now here’s why I had “Perfect Healing”👄
1.) #ButGod 😇
2.) I’m in great health! I lost ALOT of blood from my lip, but because I take great care of myself(eat right & exercise)- all my vital signs were on point ☝🏽 I didn’t need a blood transfusion, not even an aspirin💊(So please take care of yourself❣️)
3.) FYI-I didn’t wear makeup 💄 especially lipstick for 6 weeks. (Y'all know I’m not for all those chemicals and can you imagine if those foreign substances had gotten in my lip😫it would have gotten infected and I probably wouldn’t of had a top lip👄if I had of worn makeup💄)
So please remember-the healing process takes time, especially if it’s an internal injury/surgery. Have patience and pray🙏🏾and I promise that you will be okay; and, “Consider it pure joy, my brothers and sisters, when you face trials of many kinds, because you know that the testing of your faith produces Perseverance.” James 1:2-3
Note: although I 💝 a good laugh 😂 yall, but ENOUGH🙅🏽‍♀️ with the jokes: no I didn’t kiss no alligator 😘🐊and no barbell fell on my face🏋🏽‍♀️Stop that🚦😆 #ShineBrightLikeADiamond 💎#photooftheday #pictureoftheday #bestoftheday #SuperWoman #HerStory #ROAR 🐆

summary: Study Shows that Bees Love Hemp, Which is Wonderful News for the Environment and the World Just under the radar of public...
caption: Study Shows that Bees Love Hemp, Which is Wonderful News for the Environment and the World Just under the radar of public concerns is the fact that bees and pollinator insects are dying off in catastrophic numbers, and if we are unable to reverse this trend, we face a very different kind of future.

summary: It's the weirdest and simplest things that'll cause me to start heading towards a downward path. I was at the gym this morning...
body: It’s the weirdest and simplest things that’ll cause me to start heading towards a downward path. I was at the gym this morning and I saw a bunch of regulars. But this time I saw them all hanging out together. Like they were having a class. I know this is weird of me, but I was looking at these normal human beings who previously didn’t know each other but they are now hanging out and talking to other normal human beings and making connections with each other, while I’ve been going just as long or longer than some of them and I wasn’t invited to their class. Not that I wanted to be, but whenever I go out and I see people socializing I just always feel like a small and broken little thing that should never be allowed to leave the house. I’ve been going to the gym for probably almost 2 years this point. Maybe about four days a week. And I always just keep my headphones in, keep my head down, and hope I can get through it unnoticed. I’ll even skip certain exercises or avoid certain equipment if it looks like people are working out too close to it.
